BYM7N8cv60zRGgrOdODGHw.text: It's one of life's great coin tosses. Do you go to McDonald's, and risk a mediocre burger but get outstanding, gresy, salty fries? Or do you go to Burger King, get an outstanding Bacon Double Cheeseburger, and be guaranteed fries that taste like the contents of a paper shredder.  For me, it's usually a 50/50 choice, but if I'm feeling particulrly miserly, I'll opt for the 1.99 cheeseburger deal in here, where it all tastes like cardboard anyway.

4OjGwAgE0anFYykYqET98Q.text: As Burger Kings go this is pretty standard. It's busy and crowded and there's not as much space for standing and waiting for your order as I'd like for a fast food place in a station but apart from that it's fine. The staff are pretty great and do their best to get through the queues as quickly as possible (even when there's a bit of a language barrier with tourists' orders - I noticed one staff member in particular being really patient and helpful).  I wouldn't want to sit in, just because of the turnover rate for tables - it can't be easy to keep them clean and clear at peak times. However, for food to go it's fine and you don't normally have to wait for long. Since it's inside the station, you can get a 10% discount  with a Bite card, so I guess that's a small bonus that might push it just slightly ahead of other similar establishments nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger King - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu screens above the counter

KRzAUYNpg2AkU1ErQGsLbw.text: For years I passed this outlet and even back then there where pigeons in the restaurant area scouring the floor devouring the left overs. I don't even think the staff even bother sweeping the floor any more. The food is nothing to Bragg about and you still have to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger King - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The pigeons do the cleaning here, real fat ones

lxtZ_R7UD0IKVycvmN7rNQ.text: Ok. I'm going to level with you here. This place has saved my life on many, many occasions. I have a few friends in Glasgow so I take the train back and forth regularly, usually hungover, so this is the fatty, yucky food I need in that position. Ok, it;s Burger King, it's not exactly going to be Fois Gras, but it's delicious nevertheless. People have a go because it's not healthy or whatever, but sometimes you just need it. You know what  I mean....right?

ggkimtV91hqFiJSB2picPA.text: Came here to get a quick whopper. Wasn't the freshest I've had. The mayonnaise tasted old and the lettuce was really soggy. I've had better BK :(. Also they say they have additional seating upstairs but they act like they're paying a 16th century window tax by having it in an enclosed, stuffy dim space. Wasn't feeling this BK at all. Oh well.

3Rfh8Un1v-KzYQvlQhhRaA.text: Good place to go if your hungry.You get quite a big meal with burger king.Its located in waverley station so its good for grabbing a burger king and eating it on the train if you are going anywhere.
